@Kezia

The blue one was from Planar Chaos. That set had a theme of alternate realities. In one of those realities, she did not become a minion of the Cabal.

Because she is a minion of the Cabal, and minions of the Cabal are often also dementia summoners. Like Chainer, Dementia Master

Posted By: Bandswithother (5/9/2012 7:38:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*"how come this is banned in EDH?"*   
   
It was far too easy to rush out an early Braids, along with a recurring permanent or resource, using all the fast mana available to black. EDH decks are generally focused on playing the long game, with higher CMC spells than you'd see in other formats. They just weren't equipped to deal with breaking a lock in the first few turns. Plus, EDH is a casual format, where players tend to frown upon such styles of play (at least the players who aren't sociopaths).
posts.html:
"how come this is banned in EDH?"

It was far too easy to rush out an early Braids, along with a recurring permanent or resource, using all the fast mana available to black. EDH decks are generally focused on playing the long game, with higher CMC spells than you'd see in other formats. They just weren't equipped to deal with breaking a lock in the first few turns. Plus, EDH is a casual format, where players tend to frown upon such styles of play (at least the players who aren't sociopaths).

posts.post_content:
Damn, nonbo with [Squee, Goblin Nabob](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Squee, Goblin Nabob). That would have been a sick curve.  
  
I like the thought of using [Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning), [Shirei, Shizo's Caretaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shirei, Shizo's Caretaker), and this in some kind of black or black/white attrition control build. Maybe throw in some [Chittering Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chittering Rats)-type hand disruption. Definitely casual, but probably fun.

posts.post_content:
How has nobody mentioned Bitterblossom?  
  
Or at least the top comments haven't. Kinda crazy. I really want to try her as my commander while I have a mono-black deck. Same for Kokusho. I guarantee house rules would have her unbanned as a commander for me to test. She just seems so... fun. But yeah, in multiplayer, if you so much as even drop her after a certain point, you won't survive the turn. They will kill you.  
  
Kinda balanced in that aspect, hm?

posts.post_content:
[Braids, Cabal Minion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braids, Cabal Minion) + [Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler)s is just awesome.  
[Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)ed [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator)s thrown into that sort of a monoblack deck is just mean. Weak against artifacts but just ruins your opponents setup. Braids is not a team player.
posts.html:
Braids, Cabal Minion + Gravecrawlers is just awesome.
Dark Ritualed Phyrexian Obliterators thrown into that sort of a monoblack deck is just mean. Weak against artifacts but just ruins your opponents setup. Braids is not a team player.
